articles.title: 'Out of control': Witnesses describe fatal Lisbon funicular crash
articles.summary: At least 16 people were killed and 20 more injured, some critically, Portuguese authorities say.

articles.title: Legendary Italian designer Giorgio Armani dies
articles.summary: The fashion designer was the archetype of Italian style and elegance, reimagining men's and women's suits.

articles.title: Macron says 26 countries ready to send troops for Ukraine ceasefire
articles.summary: The French president also says US support for the "Coalition of the Willing" would be finalised in the coming days.

articles.title: Ebola outbreak kills 15 in DR Congo
articles.summary: Health officials urge people to take preventive measures following a new outbreak of the deadly virus.

articles.title: 'I don't seek attention', says Trump on Nobel Prize speculation
articles.summary: After previously suggesting he deserves the prize, the president tells CBS News he is more focused on saving lives.

articles.title: Israel dismisses 'spin' after Hamas says it is ready for comprehensive Gaza deal
articles.summary: Prime Minister Netanyahu says Hamas "has nothing new" and that war can end only on terms that Israel has set.

articles.title: Jamaican PM Andrew Holness wins rare third term in office
articles.summary: The incumbent, who has been in office since 2016, campaigned on the strength of his economic record.

articles.title: Jellyfish disrupt French nuclear power plant for second time in a month
articles.summary: One of France's largest nuclear power stations partially shut down after the jellyfish blocked cooling filters.

articles.title: Grandfather accidentally takes home wrong child from Sydney daycare
articles.summary: The man returned with the one-year-old as soon as he realised the mistake, and an investigation into the centre's safety protocols has been opened.

articles.title: Indian doctors remove parasitic foetuses from baby's stomach
articles.summary: The 20-day-old baby had two malformed foetuses inside her abdomen.

articles.title: Epstein accusers say they are compiling list of his associates
articles.summary: Victims of the disgraced financier give emotional accounts of abuse in a news conference on the steps of the US Capitol.

articles.title: Dozens die after boat hits tree stump in Nigerian river
articles.summary: The overloaded boat was carrying passengers including children when it hit a submerged tree stump.

articles.title: Painting looted by Nazis recovered in Argentina
articles.summary: Portrait of a Lady had been missing for 80 years before it was spotted on an estate agent's website.

articles.title: Record payout for victims of 'illegal and immoral' Australian welfare scheme
articles.summary: Hundreds of thousands of Australians were forced to repay debts, many of which did not even exist.

articles.title: Hot mic catches Xi and Putin discussing organ transplants and immortality
articles.summary: The Chinese and Russian leaders have been in power for 13 and 25 years respectively, with neither expressing any intention of stepping down.

articles.title: Guyana President Irfaan Ali claims victory in general election
articles.summary: The incumbent president claimed victory in an election dominated by how to manage the country's vast oil reserves.

articles.title: Israel intensifies Gaza City attacks as UN warns of 'horrific' consequences for displaced families
articles.summary: Strikes reportedly kill 31 people in the city, home to a million people and where a famine was declared last month.

articles.title: UAE warns Israel that annexing West Bank would cross 'red line'
articles.summary: The warning came after a far-right Israeli minister unveiled a proposal for the annexation of four-fifths of the occupied territory.

articles.title: China's Xi steals the limelight in a defiant push against US-led world order
articles.summary: President Xi shows off his power and influence in an open challenge to US supremacy and the world order.

articles.title: 'Ketamine Queen' pleads guilty in Matthew Perry overdose case

articles.title: Trump says 11 killed in US strike on 'drug-carrying vessel from Venezuela'
articles.summary: The Trump administration has signalled a willingness to use military force against drug cartels.

articles.title: Captain Scott’s famous polar shipwreck as never seen before
articles.summary: The Terra Nova carried Captain Scott and his men on their doomed expedition to the South Pole.

articles.title: Race to find survivors after Sudan landslide kills hundreds
articles.summary: Sunday's landslide followed heavy rain and "levelled" a remote village, a local armed group says.

articles.title: Xi, Putin and Kim show united front at huge Chinese military parade

articles.summary: In Vladivostok, a city on China's and North Korea's border, Russia's war on Ukraine looms large.

articles.title: Kazakhstan’s Emerging Civilian Nuclear Energy Industry: Implications for U.S. Strategic Interests
articles.summary: Kazakhstan is home to abundant uranium and an emerging civilian nuclear energy sector. With the global uranium market showing signs of growth, U.S. engagement with Kazakhstan is important to deter Russian and Chinese entrenchment in this sector.

articles.summary: “The Trump administration is reprioritizing security in the Western hemisphere,” note CSIS Americas Program experts.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: China’s Military Display and Its Indo-Pacific Message
articles.summary: Xi Jinping’s call for peace was quickly overshadowed by Beijing’s military parade; a spectacle designed less to commemorate history than to rewrite it, sell arms, and project China’s unstoppable rise.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 1: Executive Summary
articles.summary: The United States has been losing a cyber war it didn’t know it was fighting. To reverse this trend line and make full use of its strengths, Washington needs a new way of thinking about cyber conflict, national security tools, and the spectrum of war and peace.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 2: Evaluating Russia’s Cyber Strategy
articles.summary: The principal goals driving Russia’s cyber strategy across the spectrum of conflict are clear: disruption, destruction, and control of information. Russia is a leader in cyber activity, and its cyber operations pose a serious threat to the United States and its allies.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 3: Evaluating China’s Cyber Strategy
articles.summary: China has emerged as a leader in the cyber domain, and its increasingly sophisticated cyber operations pose the preeminent threat to the United States and its allies.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 4: Evaluating Iran’s Cyber Strategy
articles.summary: Iran is a rising, aggressive cyber actor. Tehran has demonstrated a brazen willingness to attack U.S. civilian critical infrastructure and will likely continue to reach for destructive tools to target the United States and its allies.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 5: Evaluating U.S. Cyber Strategy
articles.summary: The United States is generally accepted as among the most effective offensive cyber actors on the planet. This offensive skill, however, is counterbalanced by a potentially deadly weakness: a huge attack surface and weak domestic defense.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 6: Testing U.S. Policy Responses to Destructive Cyberattacks with Wargames
articles.summary: What happens when cyberattacks turn deadly? CSIS put U.S. policymakers to the test in high-stakes wargames—and the results exposed the dangerous confusion likely to occur in the midst of a cyber crisis.

articles.source: Center for Strategic and International Studies
articles.title: A Playbook for Winning the Cyber War: Part 7: How the United States Can Win
articles.summary: A new era of cyber power needs a new way of thinking and new actions to back it up. This playbook offers a bold framework to reshape U.S. cyber policy, laying out concrete steps to close the gap between the United States and its adversaries in the cyber domain.
